intro: Fagara chaffanjonii, commonly known as the Chaffanjonii soursop, is a member of the Anacardiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, with smooth, dark green leaves that are typically alternate and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by the characteristic green, spiny fruits. The fruit contains a single large, inedible seed surrounded by a soft, white, aromatic pulp that is often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
